## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 908, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 310, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 908, 320]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 908, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The coefficient of \(x^{3}\) in the expansion of \((3 + 2ax)^{5}\) is six times the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((2 + ax)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 376, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 428, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the exact solution of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[373, 98, 625, 121]]<|/det|>
\[{\frac{1}{6}}\pi +\tan^{-1}(4x) = -\cos^{-1}({\frac{1}{2}}\sqrt{3}).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 92, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 880, 102]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{1}{2} x + \frac{72}{x^4}\). The curve passes through the point \(P(2, 8)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 114, 146, 133]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 114, 551, 133]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 115, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 390, 186, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 390, 403, 408]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 390, 920, 408]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 87, 638, 243]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 262, 920, 298]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the shape of a coin. The three arcs \(AB\), \(BC\) and \(CA\) are parts of circles with centres \(C\), \(A\) and \(B\) respectively. \(ABC\) is an equilateral triangle with sides of length \(2\mathrm{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 310, 148, 327]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 310, 403, 327]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the coin.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 310, 920, 327]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 488, 148, 507]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 488, 808, 507]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the face \(ABC\) of the coin, giving the answer in terms of \(\pi\) and \(\sqrt{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 488, 920, 507]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The first, second and third terms of a geometric progression are \(\sin \theta\), \(\cos \theta\) and \(2 - \sin \theta\) respectively, where \(\theta\) radians is an acute angle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 316, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
Using this value of \(\theta\), find the sum of the first 10 terms of the progression. Give the answer in the form \(\frac{b}{\sqrt{c - 1}}\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 95, 920, 114]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the transformed curve. Give the answer in the form \(y = ax^{2} + bx + c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 559, 92]]<|/det|>
Using the results of (a) and (b), solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 100, 581, 135]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\tan^{2}\theta + 1}{\tan^{2}\theta - 1} = 4\cos \theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 140, 306, 159]]<|/det|>
for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant \theta \leqslant 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 141, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 526, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(a = \frac{7}{2}\), solve the equation \(\mathrm{gf}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 487, 91]]<|/det|>
Hence find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
The coordinates of points \(A, B\) and \(C\) are (6, 4), \((p, 7)\) and (14, 18) respectively, where \(p\) is a constant. The line \(AB\) is perpendicular to the line \(BC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 119, 460, 138]]<|/det|>
Given that \(p < 10\), find the value of \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 487, 92]]<|/det|>
A circle passes through the points \(A, B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 148, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 403, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the circle at \(C\), giving the answer in the form \(dx + ey + f = 0\), where \(d\), \(e\) and \(f\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 526, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
